sn55.51:1.1: “Mendicants, a noble disciple who has four things is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.
sn55.51:2.2: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …
sn55.51:2.6: And they have the ethical conduct loved by the noble ones … leading to immersion.
sn55.51:2.7: A noble disciple who has these four things is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.”
sn55.51:2.8: That is what the Buddha said.
sn55.51:2.9: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
sn55.51:3.1: “Whoever has faith in the Realized One,
sn55.51:3.4: praised and loved by the noble ones;
sn55.51:4.1: who has confidence in the Saṅgha,
sn55.51:4.4: their life is not in vain.
sn55.51:5.1: So let the wise devote themselves
sn55.51:5.3: confidence, and insight into the teaching,
sn55.51:5.4: remembering the instructions of the Buddhas.”
